page.title: 02Farming
page.content: The land is hilly and often rocky with considerable wear and tear on implements. The rearing of beef cattle is the traditional local industry but, in recent years, the Aberdeen Angus, the blue grey Shorthorn cross and the white faced Hereford have been replaced by, or crossed with, Continental breeds - especially the Charollais and Simmental. . Cropping is largely barley, potatoes and turnips (although much less of the latter are now grown than a few years previously). Winter barley and wheat are increasingly grown and there is a good deal of silage production for winter feeding as well as a small quantity of hay.
